thread.title: Scouting area boys and girls soccer sectionals - Post-Tribune
thread.title_full: Scouting area boys and girls soccer sectionals - Post-Tribune

author: chicagotribune.com
title: Scouting area boys and girls soccer sectionals - Post-Tribune
text:
BOYS
CLASS 2A
EAST CHICAGO CENTRAL
Schedule: Monday — Munster vs. East Chicago Central, 5 p.m.; Wednesday — Morton vs. Clark, 5 p.m.; Hammond vs. Munster-East Chicago Central winner, 7 p.m.; Saturday —Cchampionship, noon.
Outlook: Munster faces a tough road of potentially East Chicago Central, Hammond and Clark. But the Mustangs, who have won a state-record 13 straight titles and 14 in 15 seasons, clearly are the team to beat.
LAKE CENTRAL
Schedule: Wednesday — Griffith vs. Highland, 5 p.m.; Gavit vs. Lake Central, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 1 p.m.
Outlook: Lake Central has won 12 straight titles. A matchup between the Indians and Highland, which last won a sectional in 1999, could be a good one.
MERRILLVILLE
Schedule: Wednesday — Lowell vs. Crown Point, 5 p.m.; Kankakee Valley vs. Merrillville, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 6 p.m.
Outlook: Crown Point shouldn't have much trouble winning its fifth straight title.
HOBART
Schedule: Wednesday — Portage vs. Hobart, 5 p.m.; Chesterton vs. Valparaiso, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 2 p.m.
Outlook: Chesterton again has been the area's top team, and will be seeking its third straight title.
SOUTH BEND ST. JOSEPH
Schedule: Wednesday — South Bend St. Joseph vs. South Bend Washington, 5 p.m.; Michigan City vs. LaPorte, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 4 p.m.
Outlook: South Bend St. Joseph has won five consecutive titles, but LaPorte has had an excellent season and could challenge.
CLASS A
RENSSELAER
Schedule: Monday — Covenant Christian vs. Winamac, 4:30 p.m.; Wednesday — Hanover Central vs. Rensselaer, 4:30 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 2 p.m.
Outlook: The path could be open for Rensselaer to win its second straight title.
WHEELER
Schedule: Monday — Marquette vs. Andrean, 5 p.m.; Wednesday — Wheeler vs. Bishop Noll, 5 p.m.; Westville vs. Marquette-Andrean winner, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 2 p.m.
Outlook: A realignment has beefed up this sectional. Wheeler has won four in a row, but Marquette and Bishop Noll could threaten that streak.
BOONE GROVE
Schedule: Monday — Boone Grove vs. Washington Twp., 4:45 p.m.; Tuesday — Hebron vs. Kouts, 4:45 p.m.; Wednesday — Morgan Twp. vs. Boone Grove-Washington Twp. winner, 4:45 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 2 p.m.
Outlook: Boone Grove and Hebron could be on a collision course. The Wolves, who topped the Hawks in penalty kicks on Sept. 1, saw their streak of three straight titles came to an end last season as Hebron won its first.
GIRLS
CLASS 2A
MUNSTER
Schedule: Tuesday — Morton vs. Munster, 6 p.m.; Thursday — Clark vs. Hammond, 5 p.m.; East Chicago Central vs. Morton-Munster winner, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 7 p.m.
Outlook: Munster, returning to this sectional for the first time since 2012 and now as host, is the prohibitive favorite. The Mustangs have been the area's best team this season.
HIGHLAND
Schedule: Thursday — Gavit vs. Lake Central, 5 p.m.; Highland vs. Griffith, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship 7 p.m.
Outlook: Lake Central has won five straight titles and nine in 10 seasons. The Indians would be tested by either Griffith or Highland.
CROWN POINT
Schedule: Thursday — Merrillville vs. Crown Point, 5 p.m.; Kankakee Valley vs. Lowell, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 1 p.m.
Outlook: Crown Point has won four straight titles, each time ending Kankakee Valley's season. The Bulldogs edged the Kougars 1-0 on Sept. 24.
VALPARAISO
Schedule: Thursday — Chesterton vs. Portage, 5 p.m.; Hobart vs. Valparaiso, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 10 a.m.
Outlook: Valparaiso has won five consecutive titles and nine in 10 seasons. Again, rival Chesterton will try to end that streak.
SOUTH BEND ST. JOSEPH
Schedule: Wednesday — South Bend St. Joseph vs. South Bend Washington, 5 p.m.; LaPorte vs. Michigan City, 7 p.m.; Saturday — championship, 6 p.m.
Outlook: South Bend St. Joseph has won seven straight titles.
CLASS A
BISHOP NOLL
Schedule: Tuesday — Washington Twp. vs. Marquette, 6 p.m.; Thursday — Andrean vs. Bishop Noll, 5 p.m.; Wheeler vs. Washington Twp.-Marquette winner, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 6 p.m.
Outlook: It should come down to Wheeler and Andrean, which took a 2-0 decision in the teams' Sept. 21 game. The Bearcats have won three straight titles, with the 59ers seeking their first since 2004.
COVENANT CHRISTIAN
Schedule: Monday — Kouts vs. Hanover Central, 6 p.m.; Tuesday — Boone Grove vs. Hebron, 5 p.m.; Covenant Christian vs. Rensselaer, 7 p.m.; Thursday — Morgan Twp. vs. Kouts-Hanover Central winner, 5 p.m.; Boone Grove-Hebron winner vs. Covenant Christian-Rensselaer winner, 7 p.m.; Saturday — Championship, 7 p.m.
Outlook: Boone Grove could emerge from this competitive field. The Wolves won in 2013, Kouts is the defending champion, and Hebron is seeking its first.
— Michael Osipoff
